etymologies: late 16th century (in tangent (sense 3 of the noun) and as an adjective): from Latin tangent- ‘touching’, from the verb tangere

definitions: a straight line or plane that touches a curve or curved surface at a point, but if extended does not cross it at that point.
shortDefinitions: straight line or plane that touches curve or curved surface at point

definitions: a completely different line of thought or action

examples.text: he quickly went off on a tangent about wrestling

shortDefinitions: completely different line of thought or action

definitions: the trigonometric function that is equal to the ratio of the sides (other than the hypotenuse) opposite and adjacent to an angle in a right triangle.
shortDefinitions: trigonometric function that is equal to ratio of sides other than hypotenuse opposite and adjacent to angle in right-angled triangle

definitions: (of a line or plane) touching, but not intersecting, a curve or curved surface

examples.text: this curve is tangent to the average cost curve

shortDefinitions: (of line or plane) touching, but not intersecting, curve or curved surface
